title: Holiday Chickpea Sliders

author.name: Brian L. Patton
author.note: Author of Sexy’s Best: The Vegan Fried Chicken of Your Dreams.

description: These Holiday Chickpea Sliders are a mouthwatering vegan delight that's perfect for holiday feasting. Crafted with a savory chickpea and nut patty, topped with a luscious cranberry sauce and quick rosemary gravy, and nestled within buttery slider buns, these mini burgers are a delightful fusion of flavors and textures. Whether served as an appetizer, entree, or a festive lunch, these sliders are a tasty addition to your holiday menu. Get ready to savor the season with these plant-based treats.

ingredients.name: slider buns or Buttery Soft Dinner Rolls

instructions: For the quick rosemary gravy, in a small skillet or saucepan over medium heat, add flour and rosemary. Stir continuously, 3 to 4 minutes, until flour is slightly toasted and rosemary is aromatic. Add butter and cook, stirring continuously for 2 minutes.

Stir in broth, soy sauce, granulated garlic, granulated onion, and pepper. Once mixtures comes to a simmer, reduce heat to low, and cook 4 to 5 more minutes until thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Keep warm until ready to use or reheat before serving.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spray with cooking spray. In a bowl, add chickpeas and mash until smooth.
In a food processor, add pecans and walnuts. Pulse until finely ground, then add to bowl with mashed chickpeas.

Into the food processor, add onion, celery, carrot, and mushrooms. Pulse until finely ground, then add to bowl with chickpea mixture. Add poultry seasoning, nutritional yeast, salt, and vital wheat gluten, and knead with your hands until ingredients are combined and all wheat gluten has been absorbed. Divide mixture into 10 equal portions, and form each into a golf ball-sized patty. Place on prepared baking sheet and spray tops of patties with cooking spray. Bake 40 minutes, flipping once halfway through.

To assemble sliders, spread 1 teaspoon cranberry sauce on bottom of each bun, followed by patties and 1 tablespoon gravy. Sprinkle parsley on top of gravy, and place top bun. Secure with sandwich picks, and serve.

sidebars.label: Mash Up
content:
Chef Brian offers three creative ways to customize your sliders.

**Hot potato**
Add a dollop of our Best-Ever Mashed Potatoes before drizzling with gravy.

**Sweet spot**
Spoon a tablespoon of sweet potato casserole onto bottoms of buns.

**Southern comfort**
Add vegan mac and cheese, a dash of hot sauce, and smoky collard greens.
